name: The Ex'tax Project Foundation
goal: Stichting The Ex’tax Project (STEP) is a Dutch foundation or ‘ANBI’ (an organisation for public good). The goal of the foundation is to contribute to an inclusive circular economy in which current and future generations are able to create sustainable prosperity based on human capital rather than natural resources.  The foundation focuses on the tax system of the 21st century and the role of taxes in the transition to a circular economy. STEP raises support and creates alliances and practical tools that help advance the implementation of Ex'tax; the tax shift from labour to natural resources.
interests: Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Fisheries and Aquaculture, General and Institutional Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and Technology, Taxation, Youth
euInitiatives: The tax shift that The Ex'tax Project studies and advocates is a fundamental driver for an inclusive, circular economy and the policies and business models involved. In that respect the majority of EU initiatives, policies and legislative files that relate to the implementation of the Circular Economy Action Plan of DG Environment are followed by The Ex'tax Project.
